page.title: 02Evenwood Cricket Club
page.content: After a period of disbandonment{ {Evenwood Cricket Club}was reformed in 1966.The first 11 play in the{Durham {County League Division A}.During the season they have 28 league games and take part in many cup competitions. Apart from running the 1st eleven they also have a second eleven team in a league and a Junior eleven.The most successful season they have had was in 1977 they{won}the{Durham County League {Division A,The John Hodgson Memorial trophy and{The Bob Hay Memorial} trophy,which was won by the Juniors. In January 1984 there was an emergency meeting called because the club was close to folding up again.New officials were elected and all of the teams are doing very well in their respective league and cup games.
